[[=]]
**[[[completeindies-author-page | More by this author]]]**

[[/=]]
[[include :scp-wiki:info:end]]

++ **__About me__**:

I was a fan for years, I got into the series thanks to Containment Breach and I'v-//your tomato missed! Better luck next time!//

I became a fan thanks to Containment Breach, and I remember the SCP-5000 contest. I've been part of the community ever since. With several failed articles under my belt, most notably was the real success in the form of [[[SCP-5763]]], which I wrote for DeptCon 2022.
@@ @@
In my personal life, I'm a YouTuber by the same name, and I even released both a custom Magic set around the wiki, as well as a trailer for [[[SCP-8889]]]!
> [[[https://www.youtube.com/c/CompleteIndie]]]
> That's the link!
@@ @@
**If you're interested in ##green|financially supporting me##, come check out my Patreon page:**
> [[[https://www.patreon.com/completeindie]]]
> That's the link! Again!
@@ @@
@@ @@
[[=]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:sybadge code=srs]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:sybadge code=cda]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:sybadge code=lgbt]]

[[size x-small]]well let's get that number of achievements up[[/size]]
[[/=]]


@@ @@
While I've got you here, the I in Indie, CompleteIndie, is capital. 
@@ @@

-----

[[=]]
++ [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-5763 | SCP-5763]]]
+++ I dreamt I was a butterfly.
[[/=]]

Written for DeptCon 2022, this was my first article that actually... survived. As a part of the Department of Surrealistics, and my team, I made an entry that tried to avoid notn't explaining the truths and/or lies of agnostics, a drug used by Surrealistics to grasp the ungraspable.

This story is maybe a little personal to me, about my constant fear that I've gone too deep into something to back out, my fear of did I go too far, but overall, it's mostly an esoteric dive into the undiveable.

-----

[[=]]
++ [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6494 | SCP-6494]]]
+++ {{Weight of Pressure}}
[[/=]]

I wrote most of 6494 before I published 5763, but I was never certain in my skills. Eventually, with the DeptCon up ahead, I had made myself a bit of a promise. If 5763 also flopped, and also got deleted, I was going to retire from writing for the Wiki, a very-rare case of me telling myself "it's okay not to be good at something".

And when 5763 succeeded? I felt empowered, and I published 6494. It's a personal tale, Amity Thorn is my self-insert, like Lague and Blank and McDoctorate before me[[footnote]]The phrasing of that, putting my name next to theirs, implies I'm actually skilled, however, which is wrong.[[/footnote]], and it's my story of realizing "it's okay not to be good."

Amity is my hand in this universe, and the story revolved around a lot of my (and by proxy, her) self doubt. Do I leave the Wiki, Thorn dead in the office with no story left to tell... or do I keep writing, save my work, and tell whatever story awaits?

The, uh, the Save File ending is the canonical one, by the way.

As a fun thing, I did get to honor those old deleted articles in a capacity. The five hidden collapsibles in 6494, right above "I don't get it." Those are each a glimpse of my deleted work.

I think Amity's gonna return one day. (I mean, she does in 8831, but like. She's me. She's gonna be more than that.)

-----

[[=]]
++ [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-8831 | EXB-08831]]]
+++ Halloween, Oklahoma
[[/=]]

One of the first articles on the site in Series 9 that isn't... you know, an 8Kcon entry. I am not equipped for a Kcon. Yet.

But, I was inspired by //[[[SCP-8300|The Farewell, The Frame]]]//, and decided to write a story, that emotionally hit the tug of losing years of your life to the remote, stuck in what feels like day-in, day-out, a victim of nothing but time falling through your hands back into the pavement, something I think people relate to after COVID lockdowns.

To quote myself, if SCP-5763 was me telling a story of feeling like you've fell too far; and SCP-6494 is my story about feeling inadequateâ€¦ SCP-8831 is freedom. You fell too far, you felt too gone. But despite it all, you're free.

And hey, you know what? Maybe me and ThatGuyThatTime just started a new canon, The Foundation Museum for Anomalous History. Broken Masquerade and Inevitable have nothing on us![[footnote]]No, I love both of you, I love Lifted Veil scenarios. I just really like the Museum and think it has a lot to it.[[/footnote]]

-----

[[=]]
++ [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-8359 | SCP-8359]]]
+++ 3AM
[[/=]]

[[*user JakdragonX]] wrote this a while back, and when the Deer College Spring Cleaning Event, a sort-of trade of unfinished works, I decided to finish this up and post it. And, well, you get this.

My main contributions were some of the fleshing out of X (PoI-8359, Emmet Parcaval), to make him a little less of 'random 4channer' and a tiny bit more into 'digital cultist', and I'm also the one who used the article big hit at the end - which, was originally someone breaking into Janssen's house - into killing him, leaving a trail of spraypaint propaganda in the wake. It hits hard, least to me and a critter, soooooooo....

Fun fact: Emmet Parcaval is a funny name to me: Emmet means whole, universal, or very frequently, truth; and Parcaval is, of all things, named after Parceval, a herbal medicine company.[[footnote]]I am in no way saying anything about Parceval's products, from cursory glance they seem fine actually.[[/footnote]]. Drawing that parallel to the whole essential oils thing felt fun.

-----

++ Other Things

+++ **[[[SCP-8889]]] Trailer**
[[/=]]
I helped LizardWizard make a trailer for The Wonderful Wedding of William Wallace Wettle, and I suppose it is sort of my contribution to this community in the form of extra media.

= [[[SCP-8889|Read the wonderful wedding here!]]]

[[=]]
+++ **Foundations: A Custom Magic Set**
[[/=]]
If you play Magic: the Gathering, and like the SCP Wiki[[footnote]]The Venn Diagram of people who will read this page and also like the SCP Wiki is likely a fucking circle.[[/footnote]], then have I got the thing for you!

= [[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9wT6CLAwCQc|See the set announcement video here!]]]

-----

[[=]]
+ And that's that!
++ Why are you still here?
+++ The text is getting smaller...
++++ That's... That's all folks?
+++++ Why aren't you leaving?
++++++ AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
